definition: the tomb of the first emperor at Mt Li 驪山|骊山[Li2 shan1] near Xi'an (awaits excavation)
surname Qin/Qin dynasty (221-207 BC) of the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]/abbr. for 陝西|陕西[Shan3 xi1]
to begin/to start/then/only then
emperor/old variant of 惶[huang2]
surname Huang
mound/tomb/hill/mountain

sentences.english: No excavation of Qin's tomb is planned.
sentences.chinese: 目前，中國沒有繼續挖掘秦始皇陵的計劃。

sentences.english: There are indeed lots of mysteries about him.
sentences.chinese: 秦始皇陵的神祕之處真是太多了。

sentences.english: Well, is the Qin Shihuang Mausoleum very big?
Qinshihuang Mausoleum is the largest one of Emperor Mausoleums in our country.
sentences.chinese: 秦始皇陵是我國最大的帝王陵園。

sentences.english: Where is the Qin Shihuang Mausoleum you mentioned?
sentences.chinese: 你說的秦始皇陵到底在哪兒啊？

sentences.english: It is a nice site chosen for the mausoleum .
sentences.chinese: 秦始皇陵地方選得真好。

sentences.english: These terracotta warriors have guarded the Qin Shinghuang Tomb for over 2,000 years.
sentences.chinese: 這些兵馬俑已經守衛秦始皇陵兩千多年了。

sentences.english: The Qin Shihuang Mausoleum embodies the greatest cultural achievements of the Qin dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 秦始皇陵集中了秦代文明的最高成就。

sentences.english: And China's Qin Shihuang Mausoleum is the largest imperial tomb underground.
sentences.chinese: 而我們中國的秦始皇陵是世界上最大的地下皇陵。

sentences.english: Where is the Mausoleum of the First Qin Emperor?
sentences.chinese: 秦始皇陵兵馬俑在哪裏？

sentences.english: Today I'll take you to see the Qin Shihuang Mausoleum.
sentences.chinese: 我們今天就要去看看秦始皇陵。

sentences.english: Qinshihuang's Mausoleum is located in Lintong District, 35 kilometers east of Xi'an, capital of Shanxi Province.
sentences.chinese: 秦始皇陵位於陝西省西安市以東35公里的臨潼區。

definition: the tomb of the First Emperor at Mt Li 驪山|骊山[Li2 shan1] near Xi'an (awaits excavation)
Qianling at Xianyang 咸陽市|咸阳市 in Shaanxi, burial site of third Tang emperor 高宗 and empress Wuzetian 武則天|武则天
the mausoleum of the First Emperor near Xi'an
figurines of warriors and horses buried with the dead/Terracotta Army (historic site)
tomb/mausoleum
old tomb (archaeology)
underground palace (as part of imperial tomb)
Qin Shihuang (259-210 BC), the first emperor
pit with funerary figures/pit containing terracotta warriors
Efang Palace, palace complex in western Xi'an built by Qin Shihuang 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]/also pr. [E1 pang2 Gong1]
Mt Li near Xi'an with the tomb of the First Emperor
the Ming tombs (mausoleum park of the Ming emperors in Changping district of Beijing)
tomb (of king or emperor)
funerary objects (items buried together with the dead)
(archeology) grave/tomb
tomb/grave
